metadata.title: CVE-2020-12656 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** gss_mech_free in net/sunrpc/auth_gss/gss_mech_switch.c inthe rpcsec_gss_krb5 implementation in the Linux kernel through 5.6.10 lackscertain domain_release calls, leading to a memory leak. Note: This wasdisputed with the assertion that the issue does not grant any access notalready available. It is a problem that on unloading a specific kernelmodule some memory is leaked, but loading kernel modules is a privilegedoperation. A user could also write a kernel module to consume any amount ofmemory they like and load that replicating the effect of this bug.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required
